title: Fix inaccessible module pages for Subject-to-Career and Regional Language

requirements.text: Verify and fix the route registration for '/subject-to-career' in frontend/src/App.tsx so that the SubjectToCareer page component is correctly imported and rendered when navigating to that path, following the same pattern as other module routes such as '/career-path' and '/chatbot'.

quotes: The module is still not accessible

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /subject-to-career renders the SubjectToCareer page without a 404 or blank screen
The route is registered in App.tsx using the same pattern as existing module routes
The SubjectToCareer component is correctly imported in App.tsx

requirements.text: Verify and fix the route registration for '/regional-language' in frontend/src/App.tsx so that the RegionalLanguage page component is correctly imported and rendered when navigating to that path, following the same pattern as other module routes.

quotes: The module is still not accessible

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /regional-language renders the RegionalLanguage page without a 404 or blank screen
The route is registered in App.tsx using the same pattern as existing module routes
The RegionalLanguage component is correctly imported in App.tsx

requirements.text: Verify that frontend/src/pages/Modules.tsx passes the correct path props ('subject-to-career' and 'regional-language' respectively, prefixed with '/') to the ModuleCard components for 'Subject-to-Career AR Explorer' and 'Regional Language Career Platform', and fix any incorrect or missing path values.

quotes: The module is still not accessible

acceptanceCriteria: The 'Subject-to-Career AR Explorer' ModuleCard has path='/subject-to-career'
The 'Regional Language Career Platform' ModuleCard has path='/regional-language'
Clicking the Explore button on each card navigates to the correct route

requirements.text: Ensure frontend/src/pages/SubjectToCareer.tsx exists as a valid React component that exports a default component. If the file is missing or malformed, recreate it with a header, description explaining how subjects connect to career paths, and a 'coming soon' notice for AR features, styled consistently with the existing module pages.

quotes: The module is still not accessible

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/pages/SubjectToCareer.tsx exists and exports a valid default React component
The page displays a header, a brief description, and a coming-soon placeholder section
The page uses the same gradient and card styling patterns as other module pages

requirements.text: Ensure frontend/src/pages/RegionalLanguage.tsx exists as a valid React component that exports a default component. If the file is missing or malformed, recreate it with a header, description explaining how the platform helps students explore careers in their regional language, and a 'coming soon' status indicator, styled consistently with SubjectToCareer.tsx.

quotes: The module is still not accessible

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/src/pages/RegionalLanguage.tsx exists and exports a valid default React component
The page displays a header, a brief description about regional language career guidance, and a coming-soon placeholder
The page uses the same gradient and card styling patterns as SubjectToCareer.tsx

constraints: Do not modify files listed in frontend.immutablePaths
Do not change any existing working module routes or page components
Follow the existing TanStack Router route registration pattern found in frontend/src/App.tsx
nonGoals: Implementing actual AR features for Subject-to-Career module
Implementing actual regional language content or translations
Modifying any other pages or components not related to these two module routes
